page.title: 05Fauna - Broxwood Area
page.content:
The most common wild animal is the rabbit which has now returned in number after myxamatosis wiped them out. Stoats and weasels are often seen as well as field mice and voles. Foxes are here in the small wooded areas and hares, hedgehogs, frogs and moles can be seen in the lanes especially in the Spring.
The common birds are blackbird, robin, wren,thrush, sparrow, mistle thrush, starling, tom-tit, bluetit, water wagtail, grey wagtail, yellow hammer, swallow, swift, housemartin, lapwing, goldcrest, chaffinch, bullfinch, owl, nuthatch, wild duck, curlew, crow, carrion crow, magpie and cukoo. Occasionally one can see sparrowhawk, raven, buzzard or kestrel.
